awd_titl_txt: A Summit for Improvement of Undergraduate Geoscience Teacher using the Micro Spiral Methodology Transgenerational, Transcultural, and Transformational Solutions
awd_abstract_narration:
Evidence shows the exponential increase in student performance by using the Micro-Spiral Method (MSM) of instruction is effective in overcoming absenteeism and loss of instructional time which has helped increase state science test scores for well over a decade (e.g., Developmental Research School in Tallahassee, Florida).  MSM uses a recursive repetition model that causes a deeper understanding of concepts, knowledge, and skills with each successive encounter building on the previous encounters (Davis, 2015). With the application of MSM, FL state science scores have increased overall with notable increases among students from historically excluded communities, and even significant gains among these groups in geoscience scores (Florida Department of Education (DOE), Statewide Science Assessment 2009-2020).  Targeted application of MSM to the geosciences could provide transgenerational, transcultural, and transformational solutions for geoscience educators and students. The current project seeks to establish an MSM geosciences "train the trainer program" which will help interest more students from historically excluded communities into pursuing geosciences as a possible career pathway.

The proposed Summit is to gather key stakeholders in the planning of the Micro-Spiral Method Community of Practice with an additional focus on scaling the successful MSM train the trainer workshops that occurred in 2019 and 2021. Stakeholder groups will mainly be comprised of geoscientists and STEM educators. This phased program will engage geoscientists and STEM educators from Minority Serving Institutions (MSIs) in the following activities: 1) Phase One, provision of advanced MSM train the trainer workshops for MSI participant cohorts, primarily in the southeastern U.S. Diverse cohorts of geoscientists and STEM educators will be trained by MSM experts with an emphasis on geosciences, including careers beyond the traditional geoscience academic trajectories with focused instruction on future science educators; 2) Phase Two, trained individuals from the Phase One cohorts will be deployed to their respective local districts to initiate the expansion of the MSM train-the-trainer process in each respective district with a continued emphasis on using MSM for teaching geoscience content.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Major Activities:

In February 29 - March 1, 2024, Phase One conducted an Advance MSM train the trainer summit comprised of 10 X 2 =20 MSI cohort Universities primarily in the Southeast. African American, Latina American, and Native American, Tribal Colleges were selected 20 geoscienceist and STEM educators for training in using the Micro-Spiral Method with an emphasis in geosciences and careers in geosciences in their academic instructions for future science educators.  Coalitions from Miami, Georgia, Texas, Dr. Donald Plam , COO of Florida A & M University, Dean Sarah Price, Chair Venessa PittsBannister, Superintendant Micheal Johnson, Deputy Superintendant Dr. Patricia West , Florida A & M University Develomental Research School K-12 (FAMU DRS)as well as former Ambassador to the United States from the Bahamas Sidney Collie attended the summit.

Specific Objectives:

In 2024 Phase Two, the Phase One cohorts of MSM trained geoscience and STEM educators will be deployed to their respectivelocal districts to initiate the expansion of the MSM train the trainer program. In 2025, Phase Three the second Advance MSM Workshop with the second cohort of 20 MSI geoscience and STEM educators will be trained and deployed. MSI train the trainer program cohorts will do outreach to superintendents, parents, and their children who will be invited to a prototype of “Wannado City” such as “ Wannado Geosciences City” which is a miniature city that highlight MSM where children will be able to play the roles of future geoscience careers of interest. Wannado Geosciences City will be hosted by various supporters such as National Science Foundation (NSF), USGS, NOAA, and other supporters. This is to teach and inform all about MSM and geosciences and geoscience careers.  A Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) children’s show featuring the geosciences, and geoscience careers will be developed. This tool will help disseminate MSM, geosciences and geosciences careers to the nation’s children as well as their parents. The program will be utilized mix-method evaluation as well as quantitative and qualitative analysis of outcomes.  Evaluations of faculty, district teachers, and baseline state science scores pre and post throughout the program. These three phases will enable the program to be transgenerational, transcultural, and transformational in providing academic solutions to the nation’s geosciences educators and STEM educators.

Intellectual Merit of this MSM geosciences trains the trainer program will advance the knowledge of MSM, geosciences and geosciences careers throughout the MSI Institutions via professional development train the trainer workshops. Broader Impacts of MSM geosciences program potentially benefiting society by providing transgenerational, transcultural, and transformational solutions to geosciences and STEM educators.

Significant Results:

African American, Historical Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU), Latina American, and Native American, Tribal Colleges were selected 20 geoscienceist and STEM educators for training in using the Micro-Spiral Method with an emphasis in geosciences and careers in geosciences in their academic instructions for future science educators.  Coalitions from Miami, Georgia, Texas, Dr. Donald Plam, COO of Florida A & M University, Dean Sarah Price, Chair Venessa PittsBannister,Superintendant Micheal Johnson, Deputy Superintendant Dr. Patricia West , Florida A & M University Develomental Research School K-12 (FAMU DRS) as well as former Ambassador to the United States from the Bahamas Sidney Collie attended the summit. Members of the Summit team with the Principle Investagator attended and presented the outcomes from the Summit at the Association of Teacher Educators annual meeting in Anaheim California March 27-30,2024.

Key outcomes or Other achievements:

In February 29 - March 1, 2024, Phase One conducted an Advance MSM train the trainer summit comprised of 10 X 2 =20 MSI cohort Universities primarily in the Southeast. African American, Latina American, and Native American, Tribal Colleges were selected 20 geoscienceist and STEM educators for training in using the Micro-Spiral Method with an emphasis in geosciences and careers in geosciences in their academic instructions for future science educators.  Coalitions from Miami, Georgia, Texas, Dr. Donald Plam , COO of Florida A & M University, Dean Sarah Price, Chair Venessa PittsBannister Superintendant Micheal Johnson, Deputy Superintendant Dr. Patricia West , Florida A & M University Develomental Research School K-12 (FAMU DRS) as well as former Ambassador to the United States from the Bahamas Sidney Collie attended the summit.

Members of the Summit team with the Principle Investagator attended and presented the outcomes from the Summit at the Association of Teacher Educators annual meeting in Anaheim California March 27-30, 2024. Superintendant Micheal Johnson, Deputy Superintendant Dr. Patricia West , Florida A & M University Develomental Research School K-12 (FAMU DRS) participated in the February 29- March 1, 2024 Summit to plan for Improvement of Undergraduate Geoscience Teacher and Geoscience Educators Preparation using the Micro Spiral Methodology to provide Transgenerational, Transcultural, and Transformational Solutions.
